children.subject: I would put yourself on the waitlist, there's currently a lot of reserved seats for people who won't even take the class (i'm not sure why they don't just reserve these for upper div students). There's currently a lot of reserved seats for new freshman and new transfers in the Fall, though I don't think people can even take 16B their first term if they haven't taken 16A. If you look at past enrollment for the fall semesters, basically nobody enrolls during the times that new students get to phase 1. So my guess is these will open up to juniors and seniors eventually, and that the class will also expand later since the class normally has more than 300 students (the current capacity) and because the waitlist is really big too

history.content:
I was planning on taking 16B in Spring 2021, as a second-semester EECS senior. However, I've recently been hearing that seniors are automatically placed on the waitlist. I was wondering what my chances of getting into the class would be, if that's the case? For what it's worth, I do have Regents priority enrollment, and I will obviously be trying to Phase 1 16B as I need to take it in order to graduate.

I've also heard that it's easier to get off the waitlist in the Fall as opposed to in the Spring. If so, would it instead be worth it to try and get on the waitlist for 16B for Fall 2020, especially if my chances of getting into the course in the Spring are low? There's already ~150 people on it, so I'm not sure if it's worth trying to put myself on the waitlist for Fall 2020 at this point.
history.subject: Chances of getting into 16B as a senior?
